steps.title: Yarn over the hook (yo) from back to front.
steps.content: Yarn over the hook (yo) from back to front.

steps.title: Insert your crochet hook to the desired stitch.
steps.content: Insert your crochet hook to the desired stitch. Typically, you will be making your stitch in the hole closest to your crochet hook, or, if you started with a foundation chain, the fourth one. Look to your pattern to be sure. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Yarn over the hook (yo) and gently carry the wrapped yarn through the stitch.
steps.content: Yarn over the hook (yo) and gently carry the wrapped yarn through the stitch. In other words, pull it through the loop now on your hook. You will now have three (3) loops on your hook. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Yarn over the hook (yo) and draw your yarn through the first two (2) loops on your hook.
steps.content: Yarn over the hook (yo) and draw your yarn through the first two (2) loops on your hook. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Yarn over the hook (yo) and draw your yarn through the last two (2) loops on the hook.
steps.content: Yarn over the hook (yo) and draw your yarn through the last two (2) loops on the hook. [4] X Research source

steps.title: You have completed one (1) U.S.
steps.content: You have completed one (1) U.S. double crochet (dc) stitch. There should be one (1) loop left on your hook. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Insert your crochet hook to the desired stitch.
steps.content: Insert your crochet hook to the desired stitch. Typically, you will be making your stitch in the hole closest to your crochet hook, or, if you started with a foundation chain, the second one. Look to your pattern to be sure.

steps.title: Yarn over your hook (yo) and rotate the throat of the hook toward you.
steps.content: Yarn over your hook (yo) and rotate the throat of the hook toward you.

steps.title: Pull the hook with the wrapped yarn through the stitch.
steps.content: Pull the hook with the wrapped yarn through the stitch. You should now have two (2) loops on your hook. [6] X Research source

steps.title: Yarn over your hook (yo) again and draw the hook with the wrapped yarn through both loops on the hook.
steps.content: Yarn over your hook (yo) again and draw the hook with the wrapped yarn through both loops on the hook.

steps.title: You've now created one (1) U.K.
steps.content: You've now created one (1) U.K. double crochet; there should be one (1) loop left on your hook.
